article.headline: Jacksonville 65, Belmont 64
article.story: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. -- Ben Smith hit a pair of free throws with 6.6 seconds left to give Jacksonville a 65-64 win over Belmont on Thursday night. The Dolphins (1-5, 1-0 Atlantic Sun) trailed 41-22 at halftime, but limited Belmont (3-3, 0-1) to 5-of-22 shooting in the second half of a rematch of the 2008 Atlantic Sun Championship. The Bruins' second-half shooting woes came after they shot 61.5 percent (16 of 26) in the first. Smith scored 16 points with 11 coming in the second half. Marcus Allen had a game-high 21 points and tallied three steals for the Dolphins. Jacksonville trimmed its 19-point halftime deficit to just seven with 14:24 left in the game on a layup by Evan Jefferson. Matthew Dotson scored 14 points for the Bruins, followed by Shane Dansby with 12 and Andy Wicke with 11.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
